title: Wall Street indexes fall as Meta, Microsoft drag, along with Fed rate concerns
description: Indian markets saw a dip as global cues turned negative. Major US indexes like Nasdaq and S&P 500 declined. Meta and Microsoft shares dropped significantly due to increased artificial intelligence spending. The US Federal Reserve's hawkish tone also impacted investor sentiment. Investors are now closely watching upcoming earnings reports for further direction.

title: Meta Defies AI Spending Gloom With Its Record-Breaking Bond Sale

content:

title: Meta to issue bonds worth up to $30 billion
description: (Reuters) -Social media giant Meta Platforms will raise money through bond offerings worth up to $30 billion, it said in a filing on Thursday, as Big Tech rushes to fund the costly expansion of artificial intelligence infrastructure.
content:

title: Apple isn't playing the same AI capex game as the rest of the megacaps
description: While many of the largest tech companies race to build massive data centers for their artificial intelligence ambitions, Apple is taking a more modest approach.
content:

title: OpenAI, Oracle plan 1 gigawatt Stargate data center in Michigan with Related Digital
description: (Reuters) -OpenAI, Oracle and Related Digital will build a data-center campus of more than 1 gigawatt in Saline Township, Michigan, as part of their Stargate push to expand U.S. artificial intelligence infrastructure capacity.
content:

title: AI Frenzy Fueling Tech Dominance Rewrites Asia’s Market Playbook
description: The frenzy over artificial intelligence has helped Asian stocks outperform the world this year. It’s also transforming the region’s markets in a way that has fund managers racing to keep up.

title: Atlassian forecasts second-quarter revenue above estimates on AI demand boost
description: Atlassian forecast second-quarter revenue above estimates on Thursday, betting on strong demand for its enterprise software services as businesses upgrade to integrate artificial intelligence, sending its shares up nearly 7% in extended trading.
content:
Businesses rushing to adopt AI are increasingly leveling up their systems to incorporate the data-intensive tech, helping drive demand for Atlassian's enterprise software services.
